name: Ringworm (Tinea Corporis)
description: A common fungal infection of the human skin. Despite its name, it is not caused by a worm. It is a condition affecting human skin.

stages.Initial: A red, itchy, scaly patch on the skin.
stages.Developed: The patch develops into a distinct ring-shape with a raised, scaly border and a clearer center.

causes: Dermatophyte fungi, commonly transmitted through direct contact with an infected person or animal, or contaminated objects.
risk_factors: Weakened immune system, excessive sweating, participating in contact sports, and sharing contaminated items like towels.
preventive_measures: Keep skin clean and dry, avoid sharing personal items, and wear loose-fitting clothing.
solution: Apply over-the-counter antifungal creams, lotions, or powders like clotrimazole or miconazole for 2 to 4 weeks. Keep the affected skin clean and dry.
